name: Self-Model Axiom
intent: Define self-models as representations of the system’s own semantic structure within its representation space.
constraints: A self-model is a map M: C \-\> R\_self, where R\_self is a representation space equipped with its own δ–Φ–Π–ψ structure.
There exists an embedding ι: R\_self \-\> R such that self-representations are semantic states within the main representation space.
The evaluation Π ∘ ι ∘ M must be compatible with direct evaluation Π ∘ Φ ∘ δ on a distinguished subset of C.
